description: This foundation-level studio course introduces the aesthetic, conceptual, and technical foundations of two-dimensional art-making and the ways drawing informs the creation and understanding of art in cultural contexts. Students explore color, value, form, and space through a wide variety of materials. The course emphasizes strategies for idea generation and visual problem solving. Students engage in spirited investigation, critiques, and thoughtful creative expression. Materials fee. Offered each semester.
name: Foundation 2-D Media
notes: The materials fee for ART 102A will be $140.
This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
The materials fee for ART 102A will be $135.
This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.

title: Foundation Two-Dimensional Media
